page.title: 14Auction Market .2 (M)
page.content:
continued from page 13 Most of the animals we saw being bought will go to farms to be fattened up for the Autumn. Some are sold for breeding some for meat. 16 full-time and 20 part-timers work at the market. It was started in 1885 in the town centre and was moved to its present site quite recently. We wrote some poems about our visit. Here is one by Sarah Jones.
Smell There was a horrible smell, It was lurking in every corner Men were jabbering on, Cattle mooing and sheep baaing Other people were shouting and there was the sound of whipping sticks.
